intro: Hippocratea comosa, commonly known as the hairy hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are borne on long, slender pedicels and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The plant's botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
